summary: This is an email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) personnel discussing scheduling and substantive updates regarding a FOIA case related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails detail a recent oral argument before Judge Engelmayer, who expressed skepticism about the breadth of the government's withholdings under FOIA Exemption 7(A) and ordered an in camera review. The court also directed communication with Audrey (likely a supervisor) about reconsidering the FOIA response, possibly in light of a change in administration.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the court wants to consider the case and evaluate whether to confer with Main Justice on the FOIA response; also considered for inclusion on a scheduling call.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Presided over the oral argument in the Epstein FOIA case, expressed skepticism about the breadth of the government's 7(A) withholdings, and ordered an in camera review of withheld documents.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the main substantive email, who attended the oral argument, is ordering the transcript, and is coordinating the internal response and communication with the court and Audrey.

connections.description: The AUSA is directed by the court to communicate with Audrey about the case and to have her evaluate the FOIA response.
The AUSA appeared before Judge Engelmayer at the oral argument and is responsible for following the court's subsequent orders.

events.title: Oral Argument in Epstein FOIA Case
events.description: A roughly two-hour oral argument was held before Judge Engelmayer regarding FOIA requests related to Jeffrey Epstein. The court was skeptical of the government's broad use of Exemption 7(A) to withhold documents.

events.title: Expected Court Order for In Camera Review
events.description: Judge Engelmayer stated he would issue an order directing the government to produce withheld documents to the court for in camera review and to specifically mark materials withheld in connection with the Tartaglione case.

keyFacts: Judge Engelmayer ordered an in camera review of documents withheld by the government in the Epstein FOIA case, expressing significant skepticism about the breadth of withholdings under FOIA Exemption 7(A).

The court directed the government to specifically identify which withheld materials relate to the Tartaglione criminal case versus the broader 'Noel' case, indicating a concern that too much was being withheld.

The court instructed the AUSA to have Audrey (a supervisor) reconsider the FOIA response and evaluate whether to confer with Main Justice, noting the recent change in administration might be relevant.
The email chain is focused on scheduling an internal meeting to discuss the court's adverse ruling and plan the government's next steps.
